title: 109_hr152
content:
The Act titled "Preserving Access to Affordable Drugs Act of 2005" eliminates discriminatory treatment of employer plans. The "Preserving Access to Affordable Drugs Act of 2005" eliminates the True Out-Of-Pocket Limitation and equalizes subsidies for covered part D drugs. The Social Security Act allows for payments equivalent to those under section 1860D-15 for individuals enrolled in a qualified retiree prescription drug plan, without considering certain amendments. SEC. 3. Direct subsidy for certain state pharmaceutical assistance programs. Amend Part D of title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide direct subsidies for state pharmaceutical assistance programs. The Secretary will provide direct subsidies to States offering pharmaceutical assistance programs for eligible individuals not enrolled in prescription drug plans. The payment amount is determined based on special subsidy payment amounts for qualifying covered retirees. Additionally, the Secretary will provide an additional subsidy. The Secretary will provide an additional subsidy to States with pharmaceutical assistance programs for low-income individuals enrolled in the program. The payment amount is based on what would have been paid to a prescription drug plan or MA-PD plan for the individual. The Secretary will provide an additional subsidy to States with pharmaceutical assistance programs for low-income individuals who are eligible but not enrolled in a prescription drug plan or MA-PD plan. These individuals must be enrolled in a State pharmaceutical assistance program. The payment methods for the subsidy program will be determined by the Secretary and payments will be made from the Medicare Prescription Drug Account. Nothing in this section requires a prescription drug. The section 1860D-24 does not require a prescription drug plan or MA-PD plan to coordinate coverage with a State pharmaceutical assistance program described in section 1860D-23(b)(1) operated by a State receiving payment under this section. SEC. 4. FACILITATION OF COORDINATION.

Amends the Social Security Act to allow PDP sponsors or MA organizations to use their own methods of operation for coordinating benefits, excluding State Pharmaceutical Assistance Programs or RX plans.

SEC. 5. ALLOWING MEDICAID WRAP.

Amends the Social Security Act by removing subsection (d) of Section 1935.

SEC. 6. REPEAL OF COMPARATIVE COST ADJUSTMENT PROGRAM.

Repeals Subtitle E of title II of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003.

SEC. 7. PROVISION OF WRAP-AROUND PRESCRIPTION DRUG COVERAGE THROUGH MEDIGAP. Section 1882(v) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow medigap Rx policies to offer wrap-around prescription drug coverage approved by the Secretary to part D enrollees. The Secretary shall approve wrap-around prescription drug coverage for part D enrollees under medigap Rx policies. The amendments and repeal in this Act will take effect as if part of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003.
